body.name: 8 Inch Japanese Chef Knife, 3 Layer 9CR18MOV Clad Steel w/octagon Handle Gyuto Sushi Knife for Home Kitchen & Restaurant
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 5 hrs 31 mins
features: 100% from Japan's High Quality Steel - FAMCUTE series uses 9CR18MOV. A great steel for the everyday use of any chef. With an HRC of 60+/-2 it will take an angled edge and hold it for long enough to help extend the life of your knife (w/ general maintenance). The clad dimple allow for easy food release while slicing or dicing. This blade is great for vegetables, fruits, fish, and meats. [Please refrain from cutting frozen products as this may detriment the knife's edge.]

Ergonomic Design- Design inspiration are designed to show the special beauty of chef’s knives. While focusing on comfortability, and efficiency for the everyday chef. Blade length is 21.2cm and handle length is 15.3 cm with an overall length of 36.5cm. When a pinch grip is used the blade length is considered “true 8” inch” where the user will be able to maximize maneuverability of the blades cutting edge.

Full of Natural Handles - Is crafted from African rosewood, and is a great compliment to the beauty and comfort to the knife user. The stability of the handle allows the user full manipulation of the blade. This makes for effective use for precision, and endurance cuts. This handle makes mis en plas (food prep) FUN again.

Weight/Balance- The balance point runs heel to spine up the billet. Allowing the user a comfortable grip with precise cuts, and less wear and tear on the users hands. The weight is towards the blade of the knife making for efficient use during rock chopping motion.
FAMCUTE's PROMISE- Quality is a massive focus of ours products. As a promise to our customers, If you find any quality problems with the chef knife, we will replace it free of charge.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great budget gift for a cook or knife collector (or to gift yourself!)
reviews.reviewText: My knife collection in my kitchen is full of German steel, Wustof, Henckels, Zwilling, so that bar is pretty high when I started looking at this Chinese brand purporting to make Japanese knives. That said, some of these Chinese foundries have gotten better over the years, and the price was right to get something interesting like a Gyoto (similar to a French Chef's Knife).Suffice to say I've been impressed after a couple of months of use. This has been a fantastic knife that's held up well so far. It's very sharp, and seems quite durable, and has been easy to clean. It's also quite striking, friends and family have been impressed by the knife, and it's a great addition to my collection.While you generally shouldn't run knives through the dishwasher, it's actually less about the metal (modern knives should be able to handle high heat of the dishwasher just fine, though I wouldn't recommend it), this knife has a wood handle that will not hold up well in the dishwasher. Fortunately the stainless steel cleans easily, just hand-wash your knife immediately after each use, treat it with a knife steel, and then put it away. Cared for like any other good knife, and I really think this knife will last you a long time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cuts like butter.
reviews.reviewText: This knife is absolutely amazing! Cuts everything with ease. Great handling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sharp looks, sharp cuts!
reviews.reviewText: This knife has been a game changer in our kitchen game. My husband comes from a culinary background and absolutely loves this knife style. I am the vegetable girl of the house & love prepping all kinds of veggies with this knife. The knife came is a beautiful box and clean as a whistle. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great product for the money
reviews.reviewText: First off, I'm NOT a professional cook, but I used to work as a prep cook for a Cordon Bleu caterer. So while I'm not a professional, you could say I'm a well trained amateur.TL;DR? It's a great knife for the price, if you're interested in spending a little more for a knife than you're used to, but don't want to shell out over $100.The knife arrived in a lovely wood box, and as many have already said, was very sharp. The feel of the handle is quite nice, though if you're not used to the octagonal handle commonly found on Japanese cooking knives, it might feel sort of weird. After giving it a light washing, I decided to try it out on a variety of foods. The knife absolutely flew through veggies I prepped for a salad, and later when I was getting some salmon ready for dinner, the blade glided through as though it were melted butter. I've been using it regularly now for about a week, and for the money, it's excellent. I also own a couple Wustholf knives including an 8" kitchen knife from them, and my 8" FAMCÜTE is certainly almost on par despite being less than half the cost.The not so great? Well, after just this short an amount of time, not even two weeks, it's dulled a little faster than my Wustholf, but a quick bit of honing was all it took to regain its edge. The other issues I have are minor, but if you use your kitchen knives a lot and you're used to very high quality, you'll notice. For one thing, the balance is WAY off, as in the center of weight is almost an inch and a half up along the blade. The other issue I've had is in the way the blade is shaped. Most kitchen knives I've used, the bottom portion of the cutting edge leading toward the heel will straighten, so while much of the blade has a curve leading to the point, that last 1-2" of the heel toward the bolster will be straight. This blade doesn't, and curves all the way to the bolster. Not really a huge issue, but when using a rolling chop I've found I have to adjust how I'm used to cutting to make sure I go all the way through.So all that said, I like it, and I'm likely going to try some of their other knives. I have yet to need to sharpen the blade, but so far I doubt I'll have any trouble.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really nice knife!
reviews.reviewText: This is a really nice knife, it looks really nice quality & the details are spectacular. I especially love the way that the knife came packaged! There was bubble wrap around the box that it is sitting in & came in a cardboard sleeve around the top portion of the knife in plastic. This knife also cuts extremely well! Overall I would recommend this knife to anyone!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: You cant beat this knife for the price, extremely sharp and well made, rather its vegetables or meat! It could cut the wind if you could see it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This knife looks very cool. I have had it around 2 years and it is still sharp. It is the only knife I own and use for cooking. I wish I had purchased the full set as I love matching sets of things but honestly this and the paring knife would be more than enough. I am always sure to hand wash and hand dry it immediately. No rust or dulling.I remember shopping for this knife and doing a lot of research for days before I finally purchased this one. Glad I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Phenomanal for the price
reviews.reviewText: I've been using this knife for roughly a year and a half. I've honed and sharpenee it myself, it holds and edge beautifully and if taken care of will last you a long time.I firmly a believe a knife is only as good as the effort you put into caring for it, and this is just a great knife.I do say that the knife is a little bit front heavy, so if you arent fond of rocking or chopping then this knife probably isn't for you.All and all, I would put it up with my higher quality knives in terms of longevity and edge retention. Worth every penny, or even more.
